post:
I'm not going to lie to you. It's big.

It's real big.

But size isn't everything. Hell no. I've seen people do things with a 32MB VPS that would make your eyes water.

Sure, they knew their stuff and could work it like a master puppeteer and sure, some people would point and laugh but you know, ain't nobody got time for that. Bring out the big guns.

_"Dave"_, I'd hear them say. _"You gonna show us something impressive on that thing?"_
_"No"_, I'd say, loading up my bloated Ubuntu desktop. _"I ain't got nuthin to prove to no-one"_

_"We don't sees it like that!"_, they'd reply, fingers resting lightly on their Lynx browser.

Then suddenly, we'd both ls -la our Apache processes. First one worker thread, then two more. Before you knew it SSH was away and SMTP was junking spam quicker than you could say me gusta!

I knew it wouldn't take long and soon, ol 32MB VPS was struggling. Response times shot up. HTTP requests slowed to a crawl. Loads hit all time highs. I had him where I wanted him.

I tapped on my desktop IRC client, _"Do you even lift?"_

I waited... but there was no reply.
